    Create random groups

Create random groups

Source: vignettes/Random_groups.Rmd
Random_groups.Rmd
library(aquaras)

ras.Randomizer creates multiple series of groups each with randomly sampled observations. Observations are distributed such as that there are no repeated entries between groups/within a series.

Number of groups in a series is calculated as length(master_list) divided by group_size, rounded up to nearest integer. If an observation can not be found (for example because the groups can not be filled evenly) an error message is printed to the console and N/A inserted instead.

# Example with 4 even groups
# Compound list
Compound_list = c(
  "Comp_1", "Comp_2", "Comp_3", "Comp_4", "Comp_5",
  "Comp_6", "Comp_7", "Comp_8", "Comp_9", "Comp_10",
  "Comp_11", "Comp_12", "Comp_13", "Comp_14", "Comp_15",
  "Comp_16", "Comp_17", "Comp_18", "Comp_19", "Comp_20",
  "Comp_21", "Comp_22", "Comp_23", "Comp_24")

series_A = ras.Randomizer(compound_list = Compound_list,
                          group_size = 6,
                          series = 2)
print("+++++ Series A +++++")
#> [1] "+++++ Series A +++++"
series_A
#> $Series_01
#>   Group_01 Group_02 Group_03 Group_04
#> 1   Comp_2   Comp_3  Comp_15   Comp_1
#> 2   Comp_8  Comp_21  Comp_22  Comp_11
#> 3  Comp_10   Comp_4  Comp_19  Comp_23
#> 4   Comp_5  Comp_18  Comp_24  Comp_14
#> 5   Comp_6   Comp_9   Comp_7  Comp_13
#> 6  Comp_20  Comp_17  Comp_16  Comp_12
#> 
#> $Series_02
#>   Group_01 Group_02 Group_03 Group_04
#> 1  Comp_14  Comp_20   Comp_6  Comp_19
#> 2  Comp_23  Comp_16  Comp_15   Comp_1
#> 3   Comp_8   Comp_4   Comp_7   Comp_2
#> 4   Comp_5   Comp_9  Comp_10  Comp_11
#> 5  Comp_17  Comp_12  Comp_18  Comp_22
#> 6  Comp_21   Comp_3  Comp_24  Comp_13

# Example with 5 uneven groups
# Compound list
Compound_list = c(
  "Comp_1", "Comp_2", "Comp_3", "Comp_4", "Comp_5",
  "Comp_6", "Comp_7", "Comp_8", "Comp_9", "Comp_10",
  "Comp_11", "Comp_12", "Comp_13", "Comp_14", "Comp_15",
  "Comp_16", "Comp_17", "Comp_18", "Comp_19", "Comp_20",
  "Comp_21", "Comp_22", "Comp_23", "Comp_24")

series_B = ras.Randomizer(Compound_list,
                          group_size = 5,
                          series = 2)
#> [1] "Error: Tried 100 times but couldn't select a random observation that met the criteria. Are the groups unevenly sized?"
#> [1] "Error: Tried 100 times but couldn't select a random observation that met the criteria. Are the groups unevenly sized?"
print("+++++ Series B +++++")
#> [1] "+++++ Series B +++++"
series_B
#> $Series_01
#>   Group_01 Group_02 Group_03 Group_04 Group_05
#> 1  Comp_12   Comp_2   Comp_9  Comp_11  Comp_14
#> 2  Comp_17   Comp_4   Comp_7   Comp_8  Comp_20
#> 3  Comp_18   Comp_3   Comp_6  Comp_22   Comp_1
#> 4  Comp_21  Comp_23  Comp_19  Comp_10  Comp_15
#> 5   Comp_5  Comp_24  Comp_16  Comp_13      N/A
#> 
#> $Series_02
#>   Group_01 Group_02 Group_03 Group_04 Group_05
#> 1   Comp_9  Comp_15  Comp_17  Comp_12  Comp_23
#> 2   Comp_2   Comp_5   Comp_7  Comp_24  Comp_18
#> 3  Comp_13   Comp_1  Comp_14  Comp_20  Comp_19
#> 4  Comp_21   Comp_6   Comp_3  Comp_16   Comp_4
#> 5   Comp_8  Comp_22  Comp_10  Comp_11      N/A

# Example of writing to .xlsx file
  # Don't run
# Series_P = ras.Randomizer(Compound_list,
#                           group_size = 5,
#                           series = 2,
#                           write = TRUE,
#                           fileName = "Series_P Example for ras.Randomizer")
